sentences.en: 'A trifle more of that man,'he would say,'and I shall explode.'
sentences.cn: 他说: “ 如果再听那家伙啰唆下去, 我就要发作了. ”

sentences.en: Andrew , who was short - tempered from a sleepless night, was ready to explode.
sentences.cn: 安德鲁因彻夜难眠而变得暴躁, 快要发作了.

sentences.en: Catherine was ready to explode. "I think you're contemptible!"
sentences.cn: 凯瑟琳气得快要炸了。“我觉得你真是可鄙！”

sentences.en: Columbus helped to explode the theory that the earth is flat.
sentences.cn: 哥仑布促使打破地球是平的的理论.

sentences.en: Columbus helped to explode the theory that the earth was flat.
sentences.cn: 哥伦布促使认为地球是平的之说法破产.

sentences.en: Do you fear that you'll burst into tears or explode with anger in front of her?
sentences.cn: 你担心会在她面前放声大哭或是勃然大怒吗？

sentences.en: Explode outward and upward, lifting your head and arms in unison.
sentences.cn: 向外、向上爆发用力(explode),将手臂与头部紧密和谐地抬起.

sentences.en: Far sooner than anyone thought possible, the Russians exploded an atomic bomb.
sentences.cn: 苏联引爆了一颗原子弹，大大早于任何人的预期。

sentences.en: He has a short fuse , and they poke and prod to see if he will explode.
sentences.cn: 他易于激动, 因此他们故意拨弄他,看看他是否会发火.

sentences.en: Many boys explode firecrackers on the Fourth of July.
sentences.cn: 许多男孩子在7月4日那天放爆竹.

sentences.en: Many boys explode firecrackers on the Lantern Festival.
sentences.cn: 许多男孩在元霄灯节燃放鞭炮.

sentences.en: Modern consciousness has this great need to explode its own postures.
sentences.cn: 现代意识很有这种摧毁本身姿态的需要.

sentences.en: She heard laughter explode, then die.
sentences.cn: 她听到有人爆笑了一阵，后来就没声音了。

sentences.en: That old boy is going to explode soon.
sentences.cn: 老家伙马上就要气炸了.

sentences.en: The device was thrown at an army patrol but failed to explode.
sentences.cn: 炸弹投向了陆军巡逻队，但没有爆炸。

sentences.en: These are the facts that explode their so-called economic miracle.
sentences.cn: 这些就是用来粉碎他们所谓的经济奇迹的事实。

sentences.en: This undistinguished youth was to explode into a prominence no one had anticipated.
sentences.cn: 这个默默无闻的年轻人出人意料地展露头角.

words.tran_cn: 爆炸了的；分解的；被破除的
爆炸的；爆炸性的；爆发性的

trans.tran_cn: 使爆炸，（感情）爆发，激增，推翻（理论），突发巨响
trans.tran_en: to burst, or to make something burst, into small pieces, usually with a loud noise and in a way that causes damage

trans.tran_cn: 爆炸； 激增； 发怒
trans.tran_en: to burst, or to make something burst, into small pieces, usually with a loud noise and in a way that causes damage
to burst, or to make something burst, into small pieces, usually with a loud noise and in a way that causes damage
to burst, or to make something burst, into small pieces, usually with a loud noise and in a way that causes damage
